findings.title: State Variable Default Visibility
findings.description: State variables have default visibility, which can lead to unintended access and manipulation of sensitive data.

findings.title: Unprotected SELFDESTRUCT Instruction
findings.description: The contract contains an unprotected SELFDESTRUCT instruction, which can lead to unintended destruction of the contract.

findings.title: Unprotected Ether Withdrawal
findings.description: The smart contract allows unprotected ether withdrawal.

findings.title: Unchecked Call Return Value
findings.description: The return value of a call instruction is not checked.

findings.title: Outdated Compiler Version
findings.description: The smart contract uses an outdated compiler version.

findings.title: Function Default Visibility
findings.description: Functions with default visibility can lead to unintended access and manipulation of contract state.

findings.title: Deployer cannot renounce ownership
findings.description: The deployer of the contract does not have the capability to renounce ownership.

findings.title: Deployer cannot transfer ownership
findings.description: The deployer of the contract does not have the capability to transfer ownership.

findings.title: Deployer cannot burn
findings.description: The deployer of the contract does not have the capability to burn tokens or destroy the contract.

findings.title: Deployer cannot mint after initial deployment
findings.description: The deployer of the contract loses the ability to mint new tokens after the initial deployment.

findings.title: Deployer cannot pause contract
findings.description: The deployer of the contract does not have the ability to pause it.

findings.title: Deployer cannot block users
findings.description: The deployer of the contract does not have the capability to block users.
